timeline.bodyText: Let's remove the fall back for graph.elevation.calcmean and throw an error if it is still specified.
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText:
Why is this handling with MIN_ELEVATION necessary? What does this mean and what is the unit?
And IMO the method is not guarded if a and b are smaller than MIN_ELEVATION.
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
My understanding is that voids in elevation data (in SRTM at least) show up as Short.MIN_VALUE (see line 102-103 of previous version of HeightTile), so the MIN_ELEVATION check is meant to catch that since otherwise we'd be comparing a double to a short.
My thought here was that we make ourselves a bit more robust to voids if when any of the 4 surrounding points that we are averaging are missing, we average the other points.
replies.author: msbarry

replies.bodyText: Oh, indeed. You are right. This is quite surprising as we have no proper NaN handling downstream for these values. Probably we never stumbled over this as we use CGIAR that has filled the void. So yes, this is probably for another issue and good idea about the surrounding points.
replies.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText: Instead of returning NaN should we better throw an exception? NaN will cause trouble somewhere else.
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: This is the behavior from line 102-103 of the previous version of this code - NaN was the value returned for voids. I checked out PointList.calcDistance when elevation is NaN and it can't handle it. Is there code that I'm missing elsewhere that handles these voids?
replies.author: msbarry

replies.bodyText: also FWIW valhalla does a similar range check when using mapzen/skadi terrain tiles https://github.com/valhalla/valhalla/blob/9dd8b88aa93b91888c4a6da8b09454a1ec9a0c2b/src/skadi/sample.cc#L224 and has some special case handling to skip over these when computing grade/total elevation gain/3d profiles with missing elevation data. Maybe this (or a separate) review should tighten up elevation void handling?
replies.author: msbarry

replies.bodyText: I started working on a PR to handle voids downstream, and it started looking rather large so I opened up #1946 so we can discuss the best path forward.
replies.author: msbarry

timeline.bodyText: I would keep it simple for now and only use the two strings :) ? Or why did you choose to introduce this enum?
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Good call, that's over-engineering for now. Since we only have one interpolation method so far, just a boolean is good.  I think we should keep the config as graph.elevation.interpolation: bilinear so it's clear what it's doing and so configs don't have to change if we add other interpolation methods later.
replies.author: msbarry
